comments.body: Quote from: Pedro20s on May 11, 2022, 10:20:13 AMI would like to know if anyone knows of a trusted portal where I can learn everything related to bitcoin, I think it is important to learn professionally.You can as well Google whatever information on Bitcoin you want and will find quite good information about Bitcoin also you can read a lot about Bitcoin on this forum all you need to know is to search for the right topics once you get it you can read the replies of users on the subject matter that way you build your professionalism from various sources here you can easily ask questions about Bitcoin if it has not been answered before you can be sure of getting the right answer as long as related to Bitcoin users here will give you right answers most especially the high-rank members with a good reputation.

comments.author: bmwister
comments.body: Now there is a lot of information on Google, ranging from concepts of what it is to forecasts and expert opinions. What information do you want to know. Technical, mining or trading. There are many forums, sometimes information for beginners is fixed. Books and films can be viewed as documentaries. Subscribe to crypto channels. Find out about the best sites. It's all on the Internet.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Interesting. How did you come to this forum? What ways? What don't you like about this forum? I don't see a better place to get more knowledge about bitcoin than this place. This is the first step to looking around, communicating, understanding in which direction to step, and then, probably, deciding on education on other more targeted resources.But at the moment, if you consider yourself a complete beginner, communication on the forum will give you strength and understanding of what to strive for.

comments.author: DdmrDdmr
comments.body: Quote from: Pedro20s on May 11, 2022, 10:20:13 AM<…>You’ll probably need to resort to multiple sources, depending on your specific concerns (i.e. bitcoin technical principals, usage, trading, mining, hard money, history, news, events, security, and so forth). In general terms, I’ve found this forum itself to be useful, although it’s reading information here is not a linear guided path, and you need to learn to separate the wheat from the chaff. Books are likely a good source for thematic linear information, and people can recommend a series of them that align more to your concrete areas of interest. Documentaries and video (i.e. by Andreas  Antonopoulos) are a good complement, providing they aren’t part of the influencer sphere that will just shill whatever they are being paid to shill.Getting back to the forum, besides the residing amount of thematic treads, one of the mayor benefits resides in being able to interact with the bitcoin community, and ask whatever you are unsure about out in the open (as opposed to some closed communication through social media which is a high risk practice).Sidenote: También existe una pequeña comunidad en Español en el foro, por si resulta de interés.

comments.author: m2017
comments.body: Quote from: Pedro20s on May 11, 2022, 10:20:13 AMI would like to know if anyone knows of a trusted portal where I can learn everything related to bitcoin, I think it is important to learn professionally.You have come to this portal. Bitcointalk is exactly the place where all the information about bitcoin is concentrated. Moreover, this forum is the "cradle" of the entire crypto industry, because it was here that BTC was "born". All the information you need is right here. Read-study and if you have any questions, then don't hesitate to ask. The community will always help you. Just don't be lazy to use the "forum search engine" to answer your questions, because most of them have already been discussed many times and the necessary answers are available. There is no need to create new topics for your questions that have already been asked on bitcointalk.I am glad for you that you show a desire to learn everything about bitcoin and I wish you to achieve what you want.
